010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * Simple global thresholder which uses the mean pixel value as the threshold.
015 * See Sec. 9.1.2 of [1] for additional details (Eq. 9.10).
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/08/01
023 */
024public class MeanThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
025        
026        public MeanThresholder() {
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
031                // calculate mean of the entire image:
032                int K = h.length;
033                int N = 0;
034                
035                long sum = 0;
036                for (int i = 0; i < K; i++) {
037                        N += h[i];
038                        sum += i * h[i];
039                }
040                
041                int mean = (int) Math.floor((double)sum / N);   // important to use floor if only two pixel values
042
043                // count resulting background pixels:
044                int n0 = 0;
045                for (int i = 0; i <= mean; i++) {
046                        n0 += h[i];
047                }
048                
049                // determine if background or foreground is empty:
050                int q = (n0 < N) ? mean : -1;
051                return q;
052        }
053}
